member.name: T:Yarhl.AssemblyUtils
member.summary: Utilities to work with Assemblies in different frameworks.

member.name: M:Yarhl.AssemblyUtils.LoadAssemblies(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Load assemblies in different .NET implementations.

member.name: M:Yarhl.AssemblyUtils.IsNetFramework
member.summary: Detect if the application is running with the .NET Framework runtime.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the current runtime is .NET Framework or not.

member.name: M:Yarhl.AssemblyUtils.LoadAssembliesNetCore(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Load assemblies from .NET Core.

remarks.para: In .NET Core for some bugs / features we can't use the method Assembly.LoadFile because two identical types can return false in an equality. For that reason we need to load the assemblies with the AssemblyLoadContext which is only available in .NET Core.

member.name: M:Yarhl.AssemblyUtils.LoadAssembliesNetFramework(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Load assemblies from .NET Framework.

member.returns: If this converter can realize the operation.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this node is disposed.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.NavigableNode`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Add a node.

remarks.para: Updates the parent of the child node to match this instance. If the node already contains a child with the same name it will be replaced. Otherwise the node is added.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.NavigableNode`1.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Add a list of nodes.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.NavigableNode`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Remove a node.

remarks.para: This method does NOT dispose the removed node.

member.returns: Whether the node was found and removed successfully.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.NavigableNode`1.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a node with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the node to remove.

remarks.para: This method does dispose the removed node. If you don't want to dispose it, search the node and call the overload with the node argument.

member.returns: Whether the node was found and removed successfully.

member.summary: Removes and dispose all the children from the node.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.Navigator.SearchNode``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Search a node by path.
member.param: The root node to start the search.
member.returns: Node or null if not found.

remarks.para: If the path starts with the path separator '/', it is considered to be a full path. Otherwise, it would be a relative path starting with the node in the argument.

member.summary: Iterates the nodes recursively.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the format is a container of nodes.
member.value: if the format is a container; otherwise, .

member.summary: Gets the format as the specified type.
member.returns: The format casted to the type or null if not possible.

member.name: M:Yarhl.FileSystem.Node.ChangeFormat(Yarhl.FileFormat.IFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the format of the current node.

remarks.para: If the previous format was a container, this method will remove the children of the node. If the new format is a container, this method will add the format children to the node.
If the new format is the same reference as the current format the method is a no-op.

member.param: If the method will dispose the previous format.

member.summary: Transforms the node format to the specified format.

member.summary: Reads a char.
member.remarks: This method read one code units. A code unit may not represent a full grapheme. This method may return corrupted code units and may advance a wrong number of bytes if the given number of code units to read are not enough to represent a grapheme.
member.param: Encoding to use or null to use .

member.name: M:Yarhl.IO.DataReader.ReadChars(System.Int32,System.Text.Encoding)

member.param: The number of chars (code-units) to read.
Encoding to use or null to use .

member.summary: Creates a new from a section of a .

Check if you don't want this behavior.

remarks.p: The dispose ownership is not transferred to the new . Instead, the caller is still responsible to dispose according the stream argument.

member.name: T:Yarhl.IO.FileOpenMode
member.summary: Mode to open files.

member.name: F:Yarhl.IO.FileOpenMode.Read
member.summary: Open the file for reading. If the file doesn't exist it will throw a FileNotFound exception. Requires reading permissions.

member.name: F:Yarhl.IO.FileOpenMode.Write
member.summary: Open a file for writing. If the file doesn't exist it will be created. If the file exists it will be truncated and start writing from the beginning. Requires writing permissions.

member.name: F:Yarhl.IO.FileOpenMode.ReadWrite
member.summary: Open a file for reading and/or writing. If the file doesn't exist it wll be created. If the file exists it will start writing from the beginning but not truncated. Requires reading and writing permissions.

member.name: F:Yarhl.IO.FileOpenMode.Append
member.summary: Open a file for appending data at the end. If the file doesn't exist it will throw an exception. Requires writing permissions.
